metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5182 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a text string that happens to be a filename in the operating system's native format is dragged and dropped onto the addressbar the specified local file will be opened. This is contrary to policy and is what would happen if the string were the equivalent "file:" URL. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
